column1: This test is done in a hospital radiology department.
Some of these include: - Inflammation of the small bowel (such as Crohn disease) - Malabsorption - Narrowing or stricture of the intestine - Small bowel blockage - Tumors of the small intestine

Rare complications include: - Allergic reactions to medications prescribed for the examination (ask your health care provider about any known drug sensitivities) - Possible injury to bowel structures during the study Barium may cause constipation.
